intro: Iris iberica var. robusta, commonly known as the robust iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It typically grows to a height of 60–100 cm, featuring upright, sword-shaped leaves that are dark green and glossy. The plant produces striking blue to violet flowers with three upright petals and three recurved sepals, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. This variety is valued for its ornamental qualities and is often cultivated in gardens and wetland habitats.
